params.priority: Request priority. The default value is 102

com.huawei.hms.location.LocationRequest..methodDes: Sets the maximum waiting time, in milliseconds.

params.obj: The reference object with which to compare

com.huawei.hms.location.LocationRequest..returns: boolean:true if this object is the same as the obj argument; false otherwise

com.huawei.hms.location.LocationRequest..methodDes: Sets the interval for requesting location updates, in milliseconds.

params.millis: Request expiration duration, in milliseconds. The default value is Long.MAX_VALUE

com.huawei.hms.location.LocationRequest..returns: int:a hash code value for this object

com.huawei.hms.location.LocationRequest..methodDes: Sets the smallest displacement between two locations, in meters.
Sets the shortest interval for requesting location updates, in milliseconds. The values of Interval and FastestInterval, whichever is smaller, will be used for requesting location updates.

params.millis: Shortest request interval, in milliseconds. The default value is 600000. If another app initiates a location request, the location is also reported to that app at the interval specified in fastestInterval

com.huawei.hms.location.LocationRequest..returns: java.lang.String:a string representation of the object

com.huawei.hms.location.LocationRequest..methodDes: Sets the request expiration time, in milliseconds.

params.millis: Request expiration duration, in milliseconds. The default value is Long.MAX_VALUE

com.huawei.hms.location.LocationRequest..methodDes: Sets whether to return the address information.

params.needAddress: Whether to return the address information. The default value is false

params.language: Language. The value is a two-letter code complying with the ISO 639-1 standard. By default, this parameter is an empty string

params.countryCode: Country/region code. The value is a two-letter code complying with the ISO 3166-1 standard. By default, this parameter is an empty string

com.huawei.hms.location.LocationRequest..des: Used to request the most accurate location.
Used to request the city-level location.
Used to request the location with the optimal accuracy without additional power consumption.
Used to request the block-level location.
Used to request the high-precision location information. Currently, this parameter is available only for the requestLocationUpdatesEx API.

com.huawei.hms.location.GeofenceService.classDes: Geofence location class, which is used for interaction during location.

com.huawei.hms.location.GeofenceService..methodDes: Adds geofences through PendingIntent. When a geofence is triggered, a notification will be broadcasted.

params.pendingIntent: PendingIntent associated with each geofence request. When building a PendingIntent object, you need to set Class and Action. Do not build an empty intent

com.huawei.hms.location.GeofenceService..returns: com.huawei.hmf.tasks.Task<java.lang.Void>: Task execution result. You can add the onComplete(Task task) callback to receive the adding result. If task.isSuccessful() returns true, the geofences are added successfully. Otherwise, the geofences fail to be added

com.huawei.hms.location.GeofenceService..methodDes: Removes geofences associated with a PendingIntent. An error will be reported if PendingIntent is empty.

params.pendingIntent: PendingIntent associated with geofences to be removed

com.huawei.hms.location.GeofenceService..returns: com.huawei.hmf.tasks.Task<java.lang.Void>: Task execution result. You can add the onComplete(Task task) callback to receive the removal result. If task.isSuccessful() returns true, the geofences are removed successfully. Otherwise, the geofences fail to be removed

com.huawei.hms.location.GeofenceService..methodDes: Removes geofences by their request IDs. An error will be reported if the list is empty.

params.geofenceRequestIds: Request IDs of geofences to be removed

com.huawei.hms.location.GeofenceService..returns: com.huawei.hmf.tasks.Task<java.lang.Void>: Task execution result. You can add the onComplete(Task task) callback to receive the removal result. If task.isSuccessful() returns true, the geofences are removed successfully. Otherwise, the geofences fail to be removed

Exceptions.java.lang.NullPointerException: If geofenceRequestIds is null or an empty string

com.huawei.hms.location.GeofenceRequest..des: ENTER_INIT_CONVERSION is triggered immediately when a request is initiated to add the geofence where a user device has already entered.
DWELL_INIT_CONVERSION is triggered immediately when a request is initiated to add the geofence where a user device has already entered and stayed for the specified duration.
EXIT_INIT_CONVERSION is triggered immediately when a request is initiated to add the geofence where a user device has already exit.

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityConversi.returns: int:Activity type

params.obj: The reference object with which to compare

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityConversi.returns: boolean:true if this object is the same as the obj argument; false otherwise
java.lang.String:a string representation of the object

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityConversi.des: Used to deserialize activity conversion events.

com.huawei.hms.location.LocationSettings.des: Position settings specific status code, which is used in getStatusCode().

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentifi.classDes: Entry to the activity identification service, which is used to obtain an ActivityIdentificationService instance.

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentifi.methodDes: This API is used to create an ActivityIdentificationService instance.
com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentifi.returns: com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentificationService:ActivityIdentificationService instance obtained based on the context

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentifi.methodDes: This API is used to create an ActivityIdentificationService instance, which is used in an activity.
com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentifi.returns: com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentificationService:ActivityIdentificationService instance obtained based on the activity

params.dest: The Parcel in which the object should be written
params.flags: Additional flags about how the object should be written

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityConversi.returns: void

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityConversi.methodDes: This API is used to obtain the activity status of the current activity conversion instance.
com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityConversi.returns: int:Activity type

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityConversi.methodDes: This API is used to obtain the conversion status of the current activity conversion instance.
com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityConversi.returns: int:Activity conversion information.The options are  ENTER_ACTIVITY_CONVERSION and EXIT_ACTIVITY_CONVERSION��
java.lang.String:a string representation of the object

params.obj: The reference object with which to compare

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityConversi.returns: boolean:true if this object is the same as the obj argument; false otherwise
int:a hash code value for this object

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityConversi.des: A user enters the given activity. The value is 0.
A user exits the given activity. The value is 1.
Used to deserialize activity conversion information.

params.dest: The Parcel in which the object should be written
params.flags: Additional flags about how the object should be written

com.huawei.hms.location.LocationSettings.methodDes: This API is used to obtain the Status object.
This API is used to obtain the LocationSettingsStates object.

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentifi.returns: java.lang.String:a string representation of the object

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentifi.methodDes: This API is used to obtain the type of the detected activity.
This API is used to obtain the confidence for the user to execute the activity.

params.dest: The Parcel in which the object should be written
params.flags: Additional flags about how the object should be written

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentifi.methodDes: This API is used to construct a ActivityIdentificationData object.

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentifi.des: The user of the device is walking,it is a sub-activity of FOOT.
The device is in a vehicle, such as a car.
The user of the device is running,it is a sub-activity of FOOT.
The device has an obvious tilt change.
The current activity cannot be detected.
The device user is walking or running.
The device is on a bicycle.

com.huawei.hms.location.LocationCallback.classDes: Callback class for reporting location information.

com.huawei.hms.location.LocationCallback.methodDes: This API is called when a change occurs in the availability of location data.
This API is called when device location information is available.

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentifi.returns: java.lang.String:a string representation of the object

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentifi.methodDes: This API is used to obtain ActivityIdentificationResponse from extras of Intent sent by the activity Identification service.

params.intent: The intent was sent from the activity identification service

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentifi.returns: com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentificationResponse:If the Intent does not contain ActivityIdentificationResponse, null is returned

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentifi.methodDes: This API is used to obtain the time of this identification, which is in milliseconds since January 1, 1970,obtained by System.currentTimeMillis().
This API is used to obtain the list of activitiy identification list. The activity identifications are sorted by most probable activity first.

This API returns true if an Intent contains the ActivityIdentificationResponse object.This is a utility function that can be called inside an intent receiver to ensure that the received Intent is from activity identification.

params.intent: The intent was sent from the activity identification service

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentifi.returns: boolean:If the Intent contains ActivityIdentificationResponse, this parameter returns true. If the Intent is null or does not contain ActivityIdentificationResponse, this parameter returns false

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentifi.methodDes: This API is used to obtain the most probable activity identification of the user.

params.dest: The Parcel in which the object should be written
params.flags: Additional flags about how the object should be written

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentifi.methodDes: This API is used to obtain the elapsed real time (in milliseconds) of this detection since boot, including sleeping time obtained by SystemClock.elapsedRealtimeNanos().

params.activityIdentificationDatas: List of all activitiy identifications in the period. The activitiy identifications are sorted by confidence
params.time: Identification time. The value is the number of seconds elapsed since 00:00:00 of January 1, 1970
params.elapsedTimeFromReboot: Identification time. Number of nanoseconds since boot

params.mostActivityIdentificationData: Most possible activity identification in the period
params.time: Identification time. The value is the number of seconds elapsed since 00:00:00 of January 1, 1970
params.elapsedTimeFromReboot: Identification time. Number of nanoseconds since boot

com.huawei.hms.location.ActivityIdentifi.des: Used to deserialize the activity identification result.

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.classDes: Location information, including the detailed address.

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getLa.methodDes: Obtains the latitude of the current location.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getLa.returns: double: Latitude of the current location. If no latitude is available, 0.0 will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getLo.methodDes: Obtains the longitude of the current location.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getLo.returns: double: Longitude of the current location. If no longitude is available, 0.0 will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getAl.methodDes: Obtains the altitude of the current location.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getAl.returns: double: Altitude of the current location. If no altitude is available, 0.0 will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getSp.methodDes: Obtains the device speed at the current location, in meters per second.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getSp.returns: float: Device speed at the current location, in meters per second. If no speed is available, 0.0 will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getBe.methodDes: Obtains the device bearing at the current location, in degrees.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getBe.returns: float: Device bearing at the current location, in degrees. If no bearing is available, 0.0 will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getAc.methodDes: Obtains the horizontal location accuracy, in meters.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getAc.returns: float: Horizontal location accuracy, in meters. If no accuracy is available, 0.0 will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getVe.methodDes: Obtains the vertical location accuracy, in meters.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getVe.returns: float: Vertical location accuracy, in meters. If no accuracy is available, 0.0 will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getSp.methodDes: Obtains the speed accuracy at the current location, in meters per second.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getSp.returns: float: Device speed accuracy at the current location, in meters per second. If no speed accuracy is available, 0.0 will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getBe.methodDes: Obtains the bearing accuracy at the current location, in degrees.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getBe.returns: float: Bearing accuracy of the current location, in degrees. If no bearing accuracy is available, 0.0 will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getPr.methodDes: Obtains the location method, for example, network location, GPS, Wi-Fi, and Bluetooth.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getPr.returns: java.lang.String: Location method, such as network location, GPS, Wi-Fi, and Bluetooth. If no location method is available, null will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getTi.methodDes: Obtains the current timestamp, in milliseconds.

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getEl.methodDes: Obtains the time elapsed since system boot, in nanoseconds.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getEl.returns: long: Time elapsed since system boot, in nanoseconds

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getCo.methodDes: Obtains the country code of the current location. The value is a two-letter code complying with the ISO 3166-1 standard.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getCo.returns: java.lang.String: Country code. The value is a two-letter code complying with the ISO 3166-1 standard. If no country code is available, null will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getCo.methodDes: Obtains the country name of the current location.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getCo.returns: java.lang.String: Country name. If no country name is available, null will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getSt.methodDes: Obtains the administrative region to which the current location belongs.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getSt.returns: java.lang.String: Administrative region. If no administrative region is available, null will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getCi.methodDes: Obtains the city to which the current location belongs.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getCi.returns: java.lang.String: City. If no city is available, null will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getCo.methodDes: Obtains the district/county to which the current location belongs.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getCo.returns: java.lang.String: District/county. If no district/county is available, null will be returned.

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getSt.methodDes: Obtains the street to which the current location belongs.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getSt.returns: java.lang.String: Street. If no street is available, null will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getFe.methodDes: Obtains the feature building of the current location.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getFe.returns: java.lang.String: Feature building of the current location. If no feature building is available, null will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getPo.methodDes: Obtains the postal code of the current location.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getPo.returns: java.lang.String: Postal code of the current location. If no postal code is available, null will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getPh.methodDes: Obtains the phone number of the feature building (such as a store or company) of the current location.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getPh.returns: java.lang.String: Phone number of the feature building (such as a store or company) of the current location. If no phone number is available, null will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getUr.methodDes: Obtains the website of the feature building (such as a store or company) of the current location.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getUr.returns: java.lang.String: Website of the feature building (such as a store or company) of the current location. If no website is available, null will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getEx.methodDes: Obtains additional information about the current location.
com.huawei.hms.location.HWLocation.getEx.returns: java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>: Additional information, which is a key-value pair. If no additional information is available, null will be returned

com.huawei.hms.location.LocationEnhanceS.classDes: Extension class for obtaining the navigation status and checking whether the user device supports high-precision location.

com.huawei.hms.location.LocationEnhanceS.returns: com.huawei.hmf.tasks.Task<com.huawei.hms.location.NavigationResult>: Task execution result. You can add listeners using addOnSuccessListener() and addOnFailureListener() to obtain the current method execution result. If the execution fails, the getStatusCode() method of ApiException is used to obtain the result code. The result code 6 indicates failure. (Information can be provided to instruct users to modify location settings to solve the problem.)

com.huawei.hms.location.NavigationReques.des: Used to check whether the device supports high-precision location.

com.huawei.hms.location.NavigationResult.methodDes: Obtains the confidence of the status information. The value ranges from 0 to 100. A larger value indicates more reliable result authenticity.
